content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Great puzzle, very hard to solve without timeout in some tests (my code needs more optimizations yet)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Great puzzle, the description is clear and the testcases are of suitable increasing difficulty, hinting more than once at the required optimizations. The issues I had with my code in a slow language (ruby) are completely solved, and even if the timings are a bit close (some tests/validators near the ~5sec mark), I ran the full testset 5 times and passed every time*.

As @Timinator said, it is a very challengling puzzle, probably on the higher end of the hards, but definitely a fun one.

*Now, my solution is deterministic (as I imagine everyone else's will be), so I wonder if other different strategies may still find themselves timeoutted (by a low margin). Other solvers may have to give feedback on that.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Outstanding puzzle with so many wonderful aspects. The write-up is well done and the test cases are beautifully constructed. I struggled significantly to make my algorithm fast enough, and for at least a month or so, I completely gave up. Very rewarding to finally cross the finish line!
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!

In case your interested in my experience with test case progression, I am currently timing out 9, 11, 12 and 29. I can solve the rest within the Python time limit. The only validator I'm timing out on is 12, but since I also time out on the corresponding test case, I can't say I have any issues with test case progression.

Could you take a look at Validator 5 please? I'm getting the same block type quantities, but when I multiply each quantity by each price, I get a sum of 1147.12 as compared to the 1147.07 in the expected output. Actually, my code is not relevant to my question. If I just multiply the expected output block quantities by the block type prices, the sum still comes up to 1147.12.
Great puzzle! My solution is coming along nicely. I just need to figure out how to optimize. If I could only get those damn fish out of my head and get some legitimate sleep.
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!

I'm gonna nitpick on some language things:
"Here's the blocks you can use:" -> "These are the blocks you can use".
"these are walls, pillars, ... and don't need to be covered but everything has to be" -> "... but everything else has to be".
"you also need to report how many variations can be created..." -> "you also need to report in how many ways the floor can be filled with this set of blocks".

The example at the end of the goal section could do with some formatting. The size and price numbers could be formatted as constants, and the floor representation could be formatted as monospace.

The rest looks good to me. I haven't attempted the puzzle yet.

I do hope we have more time to review before the contribution leaves the WIP status…

Goal
* The paragraph "The pragmatic in you immediately…" is confusing, as it seems to suggest that breaking pieces can be an option (it's just an "If"). Suggest to rewrite it as follows:

You have thought about simply ordering only the cheapest type and breaking them down to 1x1 blocks to let you pave any kind of floor. However, that can be risky - a competitor who did so received a lot of complaints from customers when they saw cracks in the blocks! While breaking floor blocks isn't an option, rotating them is perfectly fine.

* Please change "Some part" to "Some parts".

* Suggest to change ", these are walls, pillars, ..." to "by walls, pillars, etc".

* Suggest to change "everything else" to "everywhere else".

* Suggest to change "you can't leave holes" to "as you can't leave holes", and add "and" before "clients".

* Suggest to change "filled with" to "paved with".

* Suggest to add "Width & height =" before "7 7".

* Suggest to add "Prices of each type of blocks =" before the prices.

* Suggest to add "Minimum price to pave the floor =" before "96.10".

* Suggest to add "The number of each type of blocks to use =" before "4 0 0 2 0 0 0".

* Suggest to add "Number of ways to pave the floor =" before "{{6}}".

Input
* Line 1: Please add "space-separated".

* Line 2: Please change "prices" to "price".

* Last description: Please change "represent" to "represents" (twice).

* Last description: Suggest to change "fill" to "pave" and "filled" to "occupied".

Output
* Line 1: Suggest to change "fill" to "pave".

* Line 1: Please change "precision" to "places".

* Line 2: Suggest to change "fill" to "pave".

* Line 2: Please add "separated by a space".

* Line 3: Suggest to change "we can use" to "to pave the floor with".

Constraints
* Please change "w" to "W" for consistency.

* Please change "h" to "H" for consistency.

* Please change "[[Pi]]" to "[[P1]] to [[P7]]" for consistency.

Stub generator
* Please change line 2 to parse 7 floats instead of a string.

Cases
* Pair 12: Those look like swastikas…?

Thanks.
Thanks for the feedback, I've made the changes (except for the floor representation, I'm already using monospace),
You're right, the proper sum should be 1147.12, I've found out where the issue is coming from, now I need to figure out why PHP thinks that 20.08 * 100 is 2007

For each pair of test/validator I'm always using the one that takes me the longest to solve as test. With a different approach this might not be the case anymore, I'm glad it's also the case with your code.
I have updated all the tests/validators.
I've fixed my code and updated all the wrong sums, sorry about that.

Cheers!
And my bad about the monospace. The backticks are so small :)

I've made all the changes, thanks for these.

For Pair 12, I can see what you mean by "looks like" but that didn't even cross my mind before you mentioned it, I don't think these are a problem.

Thank you.

Hopefully people won't see Pair 12 as a problem, though I myself would prefer those cases be modified.

As a contest is being held right now, please expect others to test your contribution and comment on it later than usual. I know at least one regular player says they'll check it out after the contest.

Thanks again.
